Na tej poti bi rad za seboj nekaj pustil
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Ilona Dolenc

Lean Kozlar Luigi, 30-letni kantavtor iz Čežarjev pri Kopru, vse odločneje stopa po samostojni glasbeni poti. Pred kratkim je izdal svoj drugi album, ki nosi naslov Barve.



Lean Kozlar Luigi med predstavitvijo albuma Barve v žusternskem Snack baru. Foto: Valdi Palčič

ČEŽARJI > Plošček z živopisno naslovnico, ki ponazarja Luigijev pozitivni značaj, prinaša deset pesmi, izmed katerih sta se vsaj dve - nežni duet z Aniko HorvatPada in naslovni single Barve v družbi raperskega tria Krkuča Kunekšon - že dodobra usidrali v ušesa radijskih poslušalcev. Obe sta pod taktirko primorskega video ustvarjalca Petra Kleve zaživeli tudi v gibljivih slikah in sta - zlasti simpatično domišljeni spot za Barve - prava paša ne le za ušesa, temveč tudi za oči.
Barve kot odsev pozitivnosti
“Sem pozitiven človek, zelo rad imam barve,” 30-letni Lean Kozlar Luigi ponudi preprost odgovor na vprašanje, zakaj je za svoj drugi album, ki prihaja dve leti po prvencu Kralj noči, izbral tak naslov. Desetim pop rock skladbam je v družbi producenta Jana Baruce nanašal barvne odtenke v studiu Tramon, pesmi pa so v minulih dveh letih nastajale v istrsko-štajerski navezi. Za večino je namreč kitare posnel kitarist Janez Skaza, njegov brat Matjaž Skaza pa je z bobnarskim palčkami v rokah sodeloval pri štirih. Istrsko “roko” so na Barve nanesli predvsem člani zasedbe Ne me jugat, pri pesmi Ko ugasnejo luči, ki že na prvo poslušanje diši po hitu, je s klaviaturami sodeloval tudi Luigijev dolgoletni sopotnik iz zasedbe Gedore Mitja Bobič, romantično balado Norim pa je v celoti napisal in posnel sam.
V skupini Gedore, ki je spremljala že številne glasbene “stare mačke” - od Slavka Ivančića in Enza Hrovatina do Anike Horvat, Easyja ... - ter spravila k plesu goste brezštevilnih porok in drugih “fešt”, je kantavtor nabral največ odrske kilometrine. Glasba ga sicer spremlja že od malih nog. “Že kot otrok, ko še nisem vedel, da bom izbral to pot, sem doma vedno pel, igral. Doma je bila harmonika, nono in brat sta imela bobne ...” pove o prvih stikih z inštrumenti. Te je nato nadgradil v glasbeni šoli, kjer je osvojil trobento, vzporedno pri Robertu Vatovcu še kitaro, ki jo zdaj tudi sam poučuje, zadnje leto pa se pobliže spoznava s klavirjem, za katerim sklada svoje skladbe.
Da mu gre dobro tudi pri petju, je ugotovil v domskem bendu v srednješolskih letih v Novi Gorici, kasneje se je kot bobnar pridružil skupini Why not, s katero še danes občasno stopi na oder.
Pustiti nekaj za seboj
Kantavtorska žilica mu je začela utripati že v srednji šoli, ko je napisal svojo prvo pesem, resneje pa je o tem začel razmišljati pred približno petimi leti. “Rekel sem si, zakaj bi igral samo priredbe. Če sem se že odločil za to pot, želim nekaj pustiti za sabo.” Izid svojega drugega samostojnega albuma, za katerega pravi, da je v primerjavi s prvencem “malo bolj rokerski”, je v družbi številnih gostov pred dobrim tednom proslavil s koncertom v Snack baru. Zdaj se nadeja čim več priložnosti za koncerte, da bi svojo glasbo širil med ljudi tudi z drugih primorskih oziroma slovenskih odrov, kjer ga bodo spremljali člani njegovega nedavno sestavljenega benda - bobnar Mitja Stropnik, kitarist Gabrijel Juriševič in basist Marko Jakomin.



Foto: Valdi Palčič



Album, ki je nastal v istrsko-štajerski navezi, so posneli v studiu Tramon producenta Jana Baruce.
text:
I would like to leave something behind along the way
05 Nov 2019, 06:00 by Ilona Dolenc

Lean Kozlar Luigi, a 30-year-old singer-songwriter from Čežari near Koper, is increasingly taking the solo path. He recently released his second album, titled Colors.



Lean Kozlar Luigi during the presentation of the album Colors at the brisk Snack Bar. Photo by Valdi Palcic

CONCEPTORS> A colorful cover plate illustrating Luigi's positive character brings ten songs, at least two of which - a gentle duet with Anika HorvatPada and the title single Colors in the company of rapper trio Krkucha Kunekson - have already anchored in the ears of radio listeners. Under the tactics of coastal video creator Peter Kleve, both have come to life in moving pictures, and - especially the sympathetically imagined spot for Colors - are a real graze not only for the ears but also for the eyes.
Colors as a reflection of positivity
“I'm a positive person, I love colors,” 30-year-old Lean Kozlar Luigi offered a simple answer to why he chose such a title for his second album, which comes two years after the debut of King of the Night. The ten pop rock songs were produced by the producer Jana Baruce in the Tramon studio and the songs were produced in the Istrian-Styrian connection over the past two years. For the most part, the guitars were made by guitarist Janez Skaza, and his brother Matjaž Skaza worked with the drummer in four hands. The Istrian "hand" was mainly applied to the colors by the members of the band "Don't Me South", and when the lights go out, which smells like a hit for the first time, Luigi's long-time companion from the band Gedore Mitja Bobic collaborated with the keyboards. fully written and recorded by himself.
In the Gedore group, which has accompanied many musical “old cats” - from Slavko Ivancic and Enz Hrovatin to Anika Horvat, Easy… - and made guests of countless weddings and other festivities dance, the singer has collected the most stage mileage. Music has been accompanying him from a young age. “As a kid, when I didn't know I was going to choose this path, I always sang, played, at home. There was an accordion at home, nono and brother had drums ... ”he says of his first contacts with instruments. He then upgraded them to a music school, where he won a trumpet, and at the same time with Robert Vatovec he also teaches guitar, which he now teaches himself.
He found out that he was also good at singing, at a band in Nova Gorica during his high school years, and later joined the Why Not band as a drummer, with whom he still occasionally takes the stage.
Leave something behind
The songwriter's vein started flashing in high school when he wrote his first song, but he started thinking about it more than five years ago. "I told myself why I would only play events. If I have already decided on this path, I want to leave something behind. ”The release of his second solo album, which he says is" a little more rocky "than the debut, celebrated with many guests a good week ago. Snack bar. He is now hoping for more opportunities for concerts to spread his music to people from other coastal or Slovenian stages, where he will be accompanied by members of his recently composed band - drummer Mitja Stropnik, guitarist Gabriel Juriševič and bassist Marko Jakomin.



Photo by Valdi Palcic



The album, which was produced in the Istrian-Styrian relationship, was recorded at the Tramon studio by producer Jan Baruce.
